title: Austria Foreign Exchange Reserves
description: Foreign Exchange Reserves in Austria decreased to 31966 EUR Million in October from 32279 EUR Million in September of 2022. Foreign Exchange Reserves in Austria averaged 17663.92 EUR Million from 1999 until 2022, reaching an all time high of 32890 EUR Million in April of 2022 and a record low of 8855 EUR Million in December of 2004. In Austria, Foreign Exchange Reserves are the foreign assets held or controlled by the country central bank. The reserves are made of gold or a specific currency. They can also be special drawing rights and marketable securities denominated in foreign currencies like treasury bills, government bonds, corporate bonds and equities and foreign currency loans. This page provides - Austria Foreign Exchange Reserves - actual values, historical data, forecast, chart, statistics, economic calendar and news.
author: Oesterreichische Nationalbank
